body:
This pull request introduces optimizations to the `TryParseHex` function, focusing primarily on the ideal case (valid hexadecimal input without spaces).
A new benchmark, `TryParseHexBenchmark` was introduced in a separate commit.

Optimization Rationale:
- *Preallocation*: The main optimization preallocates the result vector based on the input string's length. This aims to completely avoid costly dynamic reallocations when no spaces are present.
- *Space Handling*: While focused on the ideal case, these optimizations should also improve performance when spaces are present since we avoid some IsSpace checks when characters parse correctly. In the presence of spaces, the final vector might be slightly larger than necessary.

------------

Before:
```
|           ns/base16 |            base16/s |    err% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|                1.60 |      623,238,893.11 |    0.3% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                1.65 |      606,747,566.34 |    0.6% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                1.60 |      626,149,544.07 |    0.3% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
```

After:
```
|           ns/base16 |            base16/s |    err% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|                0.54 |    1,866,216,380.08 |    0.9% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.53 |    1,871,755,872.12 |    0.5% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
|                0.53 |    1,875,106,332.14 |    0.1% |      0.01 | `TryParseHexBenchmark`
```
title: optimization: Speed up TryParseHex by 300%
